revisions.rev:
{{Infobox website | name = OpenBitTorrent | logo = [[File:OpenBitTorrent logo.jpg|300px]] | screenshot = | caption = | url = http://openbittorrent.com/ | alexa = {{decrease}} 405,912 ({{as of|2011|11|2|alt=November 2011}})<ref name="alexa">{{cite web|url= http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/openbittorrent.com |title= Openbittorrent.com Site Info | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |accessdate= 2011-11-02 }}</ref><!--Updated monthly by OKBot.--> | commercial = No | type = [[BitTorrent tracker]] | language = English | registration = No | owner = | author = | launch date = | current status = Online | revenue = | slogan = An open tracker project. | content license = }} '''OpenBitTorrent''' (commonly abbreviated '''OBT''') is an open [[BitTorrent tracker]] project for the [[BitTorrent protocol]].
==Description== OpenBitTorrent's initiative to provide a free, stable service with no ties to indexing sites or even hosting torrent files has been a huge public success and it has spawned several copies with almost identical services.
OpenBitTorrent has been suspected of being a part of or a side project of [[The Pirate Bay]], because it was observed early on that both sites used the same [[BitTorrent tracker|tracker]]s.<ref>[http://torrentfreak.com/openbittorrent-tracker-muscles-in-on-the-old-pirate-bay-090705/#comment-576934 Comment concerning OBT on torrentfreak.com from 05.07.2009]</ref> The OpenBitTorrent project has countered by stating that the sites merely shared a tracker cluster operated by DCP Networks and [[Fredrik Neij]] during a startup period (February through August 2009).
On May 22, 2010, the OpenBitTorrent tracker was shut down, although the site remains.<ref name="down">[http://torrentfreak.com/hollywood-lands-triple-strike-on-pirate-bay-openbittorrent-100522/ Hollywood Lands Triple Strike On Pirate Bay, OpenBitTorrent]</ref> This was a result of a case against The Pirate Bay by many major Hollywood studios. Later the tracker came back online.
==See also== *[[Comparison of BitTorrent sites]]
